dublin_core.dcvalue: The Federal Communications Commission Commission adopts various proposals to amend its hearing aid compatibility policies and requirements pertaining to wireless services including modifications and other requirements along the framework proposed in a consensus plan Joint Consensus Plan developed jointly by industry and representatives for the deaf and hard of hearing community The Commission anticipates that these rule changes taken together and largely supported by manufacturers service providers and consumers with hearing loss will meet statutory obligations to ensure reasonable access to telephone service by persons with impaired hearing These requirements are intended to benefit wireless users in the deaf and hard of hearing community including the most disadvantaged who are more likely to rely on telecoil equipped hearing aids as well as to ensure that these consumers have a variety of handsets available to them including handsets with innovative features
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T16:58:49Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2008-06-20
Hearing aid-compatible mobile handsets, petition of American National Standards Committee C63 (EMC) ANSO ASC C63 (TM). Final rule.
